Comments_List: What a wonderful opportunity to develop thoughts I had nurtured throughout my time here. I learned a lot about self-deadlines especially.

I developed the ability to clearly articulate my arguments and defend my critical stance regarding the works examined in my senior essay. I synthesized a large body of information to arrive at a clear expression of my work, and I appreciated all the instruction that led me to this clarity.
My research, writing, and reading skills were all immensely improved over the course of this project. I honestly cannot emphasize enough how much of a growth experience this was.
Very much depends on your advisor; mine was wonderful.

I appreciated the mandatory deadlines throughout the writing process, as they helped me to pace my work throughout the semester. I also greatly appreciated the guidance of my adviser, who helped me strive for the clearest articulation of my ideas.
I mean, I feel like this is really a case-by-case thing since everyone's experience in the senior essay is different.

I found writing a senior essay to be an incredibly valuable and rewarding experience. I would highly recommend this to any English major who has a specific interest and is organized and self-motivated.

I would highly recommend all seniors write a senior essay-- it proved to be such a meaningful culmination of all my undergraduate work, and I appreciated the structure of the course as well as the sense of accomplishment that accompanies the finished product.
It's not for everyone but if you have a specific area of interest that you want to pursue, the senior essay is a great choice.
